data.chText: （用刀等锐器）刺，戳，捅
data.enText: to push a sharp, pointed object, especially a knife, into sb, killing or injuring them

data.chText: 他遭到种族主义者的袭击，被刺死了。
data.enText: He was stabbed to death in a racist attack.

data.chText: 她用螺丝刀在他胳膊上戳了一下。
data.enText: She stabbed him in the arm with a screwdriver.

data.chText: （用手指或尖物）戳，捅，刺
data.enText: to make a short, aggressive or violent movement with a finger or pointed object

data.chText: 他气呼呼地用指头戳我的胸脯。
data.enText: He stabbed his finger angrily at my chest.

data.chText: 她用叉子在空中比画。
data.enText: She stabbed the air with her fork.

data.chText: 他胸部疼得像刀扎似的。
data.enText: The pain stabbed at his chest.
stab sb in the back

data.chText: 在某人背后捅刀子；陷害（或中伤）信任你的人
data.enText: to do or say sth that harms sb who trusts you

data.chText: 刺；戳；捅；刺（或戳、捅）的伤口
data.enText: an act of stabbing or trying to stab sb/sth; a wound caused by stabbing

data.chText: 他胸部被刺了几刀。
data.enText: He received several stabs in the chest.

data.chText: 她因心脏被刺中一刀而身亡。
data.enText: She died of a single stab wound to the heart.

data.chText: 突然一阵剧痛（或难受的感觉）
data.enText: a sudden sharp pain or unpleasant feeling

data.chText: 她胸部突然感到一阵剧痛。
data.enText: She felt a sudden stab of pain in the chest.

data.chText: 一阵内疚、恐惧、怜悯、嫉妒等
data.enText: a stab of guilt/fear/pity/jealousy, etc.

data.chText: 尝试；企图
data.enText: an attempt to do sth

data.chText: 尽管他觉得试题很难，但还是尽力去做了。
data.enText: He found the test difficult but nevertheless made a good stab at it.

data.chText: 无数人试图解开这个谜。
data.enText: Countless people have had a stab at solving the riddle.
a stab in the back

data.chText: 背后捅刀子；对给予信任的人的陷害（或中伤）
data.enText: an act that harms sb, done by a person they thought was a friend
a shot/stab in the dark

data.chText: 瞎猜；盲动；盲干
data.enText: a guess; sth you do without knowing what the result will be

data.chText: 他得出的数字实际上只是瞎猜而已。
data.enText: The figure he came up with was really just a shot in the dark.

means: 突然一阵剧痛(或难受的感觉)

data.enText: stab sb in the back

data.chText: 在某人背后捅刀子；陷害（或中伤）信任你的人
data.enText: to do or say sth that harms sb who trusts you
a stab in the back

data.chText: 背后捅刀子；对给予信任的人的陷害（或中伤）
data.enText: an act that harms sb, done by a person they thought was a friend
a shot/stab in the dark

data.chText: 瞎猜；盲动；盲干
data.enText: a guess; sth you do without knowing what the result will be

data.chText: 他得出的数字实际上只是瞎猜而已。
data.enText: The figure he came up with was really just a shot in the dark.

tr: informal words for any attempt or effort
example: he gave it his best shot
he took a stab at forecasting

tr: a strong blow with a knife or other sharp pointed instrument
example: one strong stab to the heart killed him
she felt a stab of excitement
he jabbed his finger into her ribs
he jabbed the piece of meat with his pocket knife
The victim was knifed to death

value.def: If someone stabs you, they push a knife or sharp object into your body.

example.ex: Somebody stabbed him in the stomach...
example.tran: 有人朝他肚子上捅了一刀。

example.ex: Dean tried to stab him with a screwdriver...
example.tran: 迪安试图用一把改锥捅他。

example.ex: Stephen was stabbed to death in an unprovoked attack nearly five months ago.
example.tran: 斯蒂芬在近 5 个月前无故遭到袭击，被捅死了。

value.def: If you stab something or stab at it, you push at it with your finger or with something pointed that you are holding.

example.ex: Bess stabbed a slice of cucumber...
Goldstone flipped through the pages and stabbed his thumb at the paragraph he was looking for...
example.tran: 戈德斯通翻动书页，大拇指按到他正在寻找的那个段落上。

example.ex: He stabbed at the omelette with his fork.

value.def: If you have a stab at something, you try to do it.

example.ex: Several tennis stars have had a stab at acting.
example.tran: 好几位网球明星都尝试过从事演艺。

value.def: You can refer to a sudden, usually unpleasant feeling as a stab of that feeling.

example.ex: ...a stab of pain just above his eye...
example.tran: 他眼睛上方突然的一阵疼痛

example.ex: She felt a stab of pity for him.

value.tran: (通常指令人不快的感觉的)突发的一阵

value.def: If you say that someone has stabbed you in the back, you mean that they have done something very harmful to you when you thought that you could trust them. You can refer to an action of this kind as a stab in the back .

example.ex: She felt betrayed, as though her daughter had stabbed her in the back...
example.tran: 她感到被出卖了，就像女儿在自己背后捅了一刀似的。

example.ex: He denounced the defection as a stab in the back.
example.tran: 他谴责这次背叛是背后捅刀子。
